result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph A. Zak

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Joseph A. Zak in court with attorney Karl J. Kelz.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case 14CM80, 14CT56, 14CM74, 15CM14 and 14TR923.  DE unable to get assessment.  Atty Tlusty requests to move to sentencing.  Court grants request.  Atty Tlusty states agreement on the record.  Court orders sentenced withheld on 14CT56; forfeiture of $2,314.00; 3 years probation; 140 days county jail with huber and good time; 28 month revocation; AODA assesment; $41 blood draw fee; IID; attend Vicim Impact Panel; Court costs on Count 2. Sentence credit of 3 days.  Court orders sentenced withheld on 14CM80; 1 year probation; court costs; DNA surcharge. 14TR923, Court orders forfeiture of $200.50.  Court dismissed, but read in cases 14CM74 and 15CM14. ba

Defendant Joseph A. Zak in court with attorney Karl J. Kelz.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.Defendant Joseph A Zak in court with attorney Karl J. Kelz.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea agreement put into the record.  14CT56 counts 1 and 2 plea of no contest by defendant.  14CM80 - Plea of no contest by defendant.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court finds defendant guilty in 14CT56 - Count 1 OWI - 4th and Count 2 - Resisting/Obstructing an Officer and 14CM80 - Bail jumping.  14CT56 - Court 3 dismissed and read in 124CM74 and 15CM14 are dismissed and read in.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 02:30 pm.  - rt
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

Defendant Joseph A. Zak in court with attorney Karl J. Kelz.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court sets bond for 14CT56 at $1,000.00 signature bond; no possession or consumption of alcohol and do not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Case No. 14CM80 court sets bond at $500.00 signature; booking and do not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Case No. 14CM74 court sets bond at $1,000.00 signature; no possession or consumption of alcohol.  Attorney Kelz requesting that the revoked bonds be reduced to one half of the original amount  which would be $1,250.00.  Court orders that the revoked bonds be reduced to $1,250.00 -  One half the amount in each case.  Court sets him up on a payment plan of $25.00 a month beginning April 1, 2015.  Case No. 15CM14.  Waive reading of complaint; plea of not guilty.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 9, 2015 at 10:15 am. for all cases.  - rt

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure. Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol.

Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Joseph A. Zak appeared in person, in custody.  Court finds probable cause for arrest without warrant based on the arrest header.  Attorney Tlusty requested a $1,000.00 signature bond; booking and no possession or consumption of alcohol.  Court ordered bond as requested by Attorney Tlusty.  Next court date is an initial appearance on February 24, 2015 at 1:15 p.m.  The court ordered that the clerk is to begin bond revocation proceedings in Case Nos. 14CT56, 14CM74 and 14CM80.  - rt
